1521965207_1C8aYoko2ccsGN96xqjCYvWV6jvMW.body:
This is a foolhardy idea. What makes you think the Russians don't rat you out if you accidentally step on their toes or linger into their territory of expertise (without tarnishing anybody's personal and professional reputation here)? What if they... no, they HAVE a clearance office somewhere near D.C. where Dmitry can phone in deals. The FBI does care about law enforcement and getting stuff done. I do not think they hesitate to throw the odd bad guy under a foreign bus if this means to receive findings for free. 
But if you just want to be opaque for the general data collectors like marketing or your credit scoring agency, then by all means use all Russian mail providers to segregate your communication with corporations. It probably will even be advantageous because they'll profile you as either having a fuckton of money or none, which depending on context can both be very useful.

It is almost impossible to time the usage of social networks in a way such as the spooks can't put 2 and 2 together. Fake accounts have no mobile phone attached e.g. They stick out like a signal flare in the desert at night. The input required to fool social networks (except G+, obviously) has to go through either Android or iOS, which both rat you out. Android=Google and iOS is being used 99.5% by consumer sheep who don't fiddle with privacy settings. A social client on iOS without telltale signatures makes you standing out like nothing else. You will be flagged.  
Digitally private and secure communication is only possible on a laptop which lacks wifi, geographical awareness of any kind and a PI-hole or similar, directly attacked via LAN, not by wifi, provided you are not under direct surveillance.

1522586677_1CuFXko1Q3MMRkboFygeu9DxNVAFG.body: ZN isn't about privacy, but "undeletability" aka against censorship. If there are more suites like cjdns around with simple and built in routing, then skyscrapers can be used to make stealth networks around known checkpoints where states and corporations are doing deep packet inspection.

Where you mount something like https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/RONJA and have stealth connections. There are some manufacturers looking into it, but it seems 5G will drown those efforts. Too bad, FSO and cjdns would fit together like nothing else. 
Oh, I re-read my sentence, I meant to use high points to route around the known checkpoints or simply go local as guifi.net does. They are so big they are "their own media space".

Every country has either the deep packet inspection boxes in place or up and running. ZN-traffic is very easy to detect and filter. There are billions on services like gmail, youtube and facebook, all pointing to the big data silos and then there are a few hundred thousand endpoints which generate weird p2p-traffic to each other in those treacherous bursts. 
Zeronet has a unique burst structure which is probably already profiled, just like they can almost reliably detect bittorrent's uTP and filter this out, while very similarly structured non-bittorrent UDP traffic gets through, because bittorrent clients have their own traffic/burst finger print. I am not even speaking of packet content, just the traffic timing, size and clustering of packets. Around 2000 or so I thought federated services are a solution, but that was before every god damn country on this earth installed middle ware boxes with DPI. 

Ah, look at this, the detractors are already here. Nothing to interrupt on the open www, did they send you here just for us five to become annoyed? Lovely.

1524327364_1GkmeCNuarifRQooJ8P5xawoXCweD.body: The oblivion problem is solved pretty easily: The creators (e.g. famous, pissed off youtube stars, conspiracy ranters like a certain AJ etc.) just have to install a Raspberry Pi at home self hosting the videos indefinitely for dtube, 0n etc.

I loathe how bitchy the "skeptic" community got lately but only a handful of them decided to at least add other sites like dtube or minds.com or - there was a window of opportunity to turn the wheel on this one - gab.ai. There are probably hundreds of local sites in all languages who are in a game theoretically very dark pit against youtube and netflix and they won't mind some additional traffic there from the big house numbers for the time being until the censors can ax them too, but I guess this train is already moving out of the station. 
To summarize: If you can produce videos and upload to more than just youtube and know what a usb-mike is - you can install some local/VPS helpers to support a decentralized youtube. Imagine a 300k subscriber explaining what ZN, Freenet or ipfs is and the exploding heads of those who want to censor them.

1537652215_1BwLxLCsQ2D6WCnjtawEvPnTYNzH3.body:
> fascism is also a form of socialism (Mussolini was raised by communists and wrote his manifesto as a reporter working for a socialist newspaper) - just a nationalist form of it.

"At this juncture the antithesis between the two theories must appear complete and absolute. Liberalism, Democracy, and Socialism look upon social groups as aggregates of living individuals; for Fascism they are the recapitulating unity of the indefinite series of generations. For Liberalism, society has no purposes other than those of the members living at a given moment. For Fascism, society has historical and immanent ends of preservation, expansion, improvement, quite distinct from those of the individuals which at a given moment compose it; so distinct in fact that they may even be in opposition. Hence the necessity, for which the older doctrines make little allowance, of sacrifice, even up to the total immolation of individuals, in behalf of society; hence the true explanation of war, eternal law of mankind, interpreted by the liberal-democratic doctrines as a degenerate absurdity or as a maddened monstrosity."

1539101626_1KuwwnkAtVrfnyhv8pyGRxLqzNZbE.body:
I don't know but it seems to me he invented a whole new protocol at one time and changed the world and now he only uses what he already invented and tweaks around. Compare this to bittorrent and the handful of companies behind it, they can't wrap their heads around their own invention. 
Both this and ZN are kludges hammered together with screeching nails on its engineers blackboard. 
Maybe it works, maybe it doesn't, but the world needs either simple data formats or simple protocol solving a problem, not a variety of different ideas chained together in a way which makes the single project in that chain indispensable AND probably prime inter pares, so you can't just make your own kludge with other chain parts who supposedly follow the standard. Look at systemd for what I mean, as a weaker phenomena, or any new web standard and what formats are allowed - and then only partially supported in the real world implementation, another troubling fact of kludges. 
I always ask myself, ok, how fast could the standard library of Python, nodejs or a maniac armed with gcc implement something which acts exactly the same?
